intro: Scabiosa tschiliensis var. breviseta, commonly known as the dwarf scabious, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features slender, upright stems that bear clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers with a distinctive, rounded shape. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are covered in a soft, hairy texture. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its compact growth habit and long blooming period make it an attractive addition to gardens.
